summary: A collection of Bureau of Prisons health services records for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, covering the period from July 7 to August 10, 2019. The documents include vision screening, immunization history, medical duty status, medication summaries, dental exams, and lab results, providing a detailed snapshot of his health status while incarcerated at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The subject of all medical and dental examinations and records, showing his health status, conditions, and treatments while incarcerated at MCC New York.

persons.name: MLP
persons.context: A medical provider (Mid-Level Practitioner) who prescribed medication (Bisacodyl) and signed off on medical duty status forms for Epstein.

persons.name: DDS
persons.context: A dentist who performed Epstein's dental assessment and examination on July 26, 2019, documenting oral health findings.

persons.name: Dental Asst
persons.context: A dental assistant who documented a screening encounter on July 18, 2019, noting Epstein had several call-outs but was not escorted to the clinic.

persons.name: RN/IC/P/10C
persons.context: Nursing staff who generated the immunization report on August 10, 2019.

connections.description: MLP provided medical care and prescribed medication for Epstein while he was incarcerated.
MD was Epstein's treating physician, prescribing multiple medications and overseeing his medical care.
DDS performed a dental examination and assessment for Epstein on July 26, 2019.

events.title: Vision Screening and Treatment Refusal
events.description: Epstein underwent a vision screening which indicated poor distance vision (20/100 OD, 20/70 OS) and a need for optometrist evaluation. On the same date, he signed a form refusing the recommended 'Eye Doctor Evaluation' treatment.

events.title: Incarceration and Medical Monitoring
events.description: Period documenting Epstein's incarceration at MCC New York, including comprehensive health assessments, immunizations, medication administration, and lab work.

events.title: Comprehensive Dental Examination
events.description: Epstein received a dental health history screen and A&O exam, which documented multiple health problems, a history of chlamydia (2015), and dental findings including gingival recession and crowding.

events.title: Blood Laboratory Testing
events.description: Blood was collected from Epstein for comprehensive chemistry, hematology, and serology tests. Results showed high cholesterol, high triglycerides, low HDL, and an elevated Hemoglobin A1C (6.3), indicating increased risk for diabetes. HIV and RPR tests were negative.

events.title: Formal Refusal of Medical Treatment
events.description: Epstein signed a Bureau of Prisons 'Medical Treatment Refusal' form (BP-5356.060), formally refusing an eye doctor evaluation despite warnings of the inability to diagnose current ophthalmologic diseases.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated under BOP Reg # 76318-054 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York in July-August 2019.
Epstein refused a recommended eye doctor evaluation on July 24, 2019, signing a formal treatment refusal form after being warned of the consequences.

Laboratory tests from July 9, 2019, revealed significant health issues: high cholesterol (216 mg/dL), very high triglycerides (413 mg/dL), low HDL (31 mg/dL), and an elevated Hemoglobin A1C (6.3), indicating increased diabetes risk.
Medical records list multiple current health problems including hyperlipidemia, sleep apnea, constipation, low back pain, neuralgia, and a 'Rule Out' for self-inflicted injuries.
A dental history from July 26, 2019, notes a past infection of chlamydia in 2015 that was treated, and chicken pox in childhood.
